name: Impressionism
description: Impressionism was a 19th-century art movement characterized by small, visible brush strokes, and an emphasis on capturing light and atmosphere.

name: Surrealism
description: Surrealism is an artistic movement that explores the irrational and unconscious mind, often creating dream-like, imaginative works.

name: Cubism
description: Cubism is an avant-garde art movement that emphasizes abstract and geometric forms, breaking objects down into basic shapes.

name: Abstract Expressionism
description: Abstract Expressionism is a post-World War II art movement that emphasizes spontaneous, non-representational expression.

name: Renaissance
description: The Renaissance was a cultural and artistic movement that marked the transition from the Middle Ages to modernity.

name: Pop Art
description: Pop Art is a movement that celebrates everyday objects and consumer culture through bold, colorful imagery.

name: Baroque
description: Baroque art is known for its dramatic and ornate style, characterized by grandeur, rich colors, and dynamic compositions.

name: Abstract Art
description: Abstract art is a broad movement that emphasizes non-representational, experimental, and imaginative creations.

name: Minimalism
description: Minimalism focuses on simplicity and reduction of elements, often with clean lines and geometric shapes.

name: Fauvism
description: Fauvism is characterized by vivid colors, bold brushwork, and a departure from naturalistic color representation.

name: Dadaism
description: Dadaism is an anti-art movement that rejects traditional aesthetics and seeks to provoke and disrupt established norms.

name: Constructivism
description: Constructivism emphasizes the use of materials and technology in art and design to create functional, geometric works.

name: Romanticism
description: Romanticism focuses on emotion, nature, and individualism, often depicted in dramatic, sublime landscapes and themes.
